trial_identification.studytitle: ParkinSong singing groups for people with Parkinson's disease and their caregivers
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Staying in Tune with Parkinsons Communication: Investigating the effects of long-term participation in ParkinSong singing groups for people with Parkinson's disease and their caregivers

interventions.interventions:
Intervention = therapeutic singing groups (these groups include 30 mins vocal/speech exercises and warmup, 60 mins singing songs, 30 minutes socialisation over tea/coffee)
Arm 1 - weekly 120 minute singing groups for 12 months - delivered by allied health professional (music therapist, speech pathologist, allied health assistant)
Arm 2 - monthly 120 minute singing groups for 12 months - delivered by community musician volunteers
As this is not a randomised trial, participants who agree to participate can elect to join a weekly or monthly singing group or be a control participant.
Mode of delivery - face to face group sessions
Location where the intervention occurs - community venues
Intervention adherence will be measured using attendance records.
interventions.comparator:
Active control groups: These groups are the same length as the intervention groups (120 mins) and are run by volunteers through Parkinson's Victoria. Attendance is recorded for all groups.
Arm 1 - Weekly activity groups (painting/dancing/Tai Chi) for 12 months
Arm 2 - Monthly peer support groups for 12 months

primaryOutcome.outcome: Voice sound pressure level - measured via speech recordings captured via headset microphone and audio interface and calibrated with a sound level meter
Speech intelligibility as assessed using the Speech Intelligibility Test (Yorkston & Beukelman, 1996)
Maximum respiratory pressures - measured using a respiratory pressure meter

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Relationship quality as measured by the QCPR (Quality of Caregiver Patient Relationship) tool - completed by both people with Parkinson's and their caregivers.
Depression - measured using the Depression, Anxiety & Stress Scale (DASS) in both people with Parkinson's and their caregivers.
Anxiety - measured using the Depression, Anxiety & Stress Scale (DASS) in both people with Parkinson's and their caregivers.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. Medical diagnosis of Idiopathic Parkinsons disease 2. Nil history of other neurological, head and neck, or respiratory disorders 3. Ability to provide informed consent to participation in study 4. Some degree of communication change reported by person with Parkinsons, caregiver or health professional 5. Mini Mental Score > 24 or with mandatory carer support if lower Mini Mental score 6. Any changes in Parkinsons medication regime or other medication/medical intervention to be documented 7. Any Speech Pathology or Music Therapy rehabilitation intervention during course of the study to be carefully documented 8. Any diagnosis and/or treatment of anxiety or depression to be documented Carers: 9. Mini Mental Score > 24 10. Any diagnosis and/or treatment of anxiety or depression to be documented
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. Severe cognitive impairment or memory problems 2. Severe language problems or hearing impairment

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Parkinsons disease (PD) is a chronic, progressive, incurable, and disabling neurological condition. In addition to the many physical symptoms at least 75% of people with PD experience impaired speech production and various mental health issues, such as depression and anxiety. This mixed-methods study aims to explore the experience of group singing for people with PD and examine the effects of long-term participation on communication and health outcomes. We will assess speech and voice function, speech-related quality of life, and communication participation, as well as wellbeing outcomes such as depression, anxiety and fatigue for both participants with PD and their caregivers.
